title: Hi guys. I have question.
content:
For the longest time I used Eudora until the developers dropped it.

I did play with GMAIL for a while but I'm not too fond of having oligarchs know my every thought.

I even gave Outlook a trial for a couple of years but I grew tired of the damned add-on developers gouging me.

I tried Thunderbird and liked it a great deal. So much so that I happily make a monthly payment to show appreciation.

Okay, so, I switched to Windows Pro 11 and installed Thunderbird. I don't like it at all. Few controls match what I knew and I have better things to do with my days than go digging around to try to figure out what was perfectly comprehensible six months ago.

So, my questions are -

Is there any chance that you will ever add a nice simple button that says "Revert to Earlier Interface"

If that doesn't have a chance in hell of ever coming into being, can you suggest a decent email program that isn't from Big Coder and that can replace Thunderbird?

I'm not stupid or lazy - I worked in IT for 35 years - but I'm long past the point where trying to figure out what the other guy did to a favorite application was enjoyable. Stable and functional is good. New and mystifying is not.

Suggestions appreciated.
creator: lee118

title: Cannnot open emails in specific folder

Even if I double-click the email in the list to open it in a new tab, the contents are still not visible.

Emails sorted into other folders display without any issues. I tried right-clicking the affected folder → Properties → Repair Folder, but the issue remains.

Is there a way to fix this?

title: Newly installed Thunderbird on new PC's not receiving or sending email
content:
I have installed Thunderbird on a new Lenovo PC using the latest version of Windows. I have copied the settings manually and correctly from a laptop in to the settings for the accounts on the PC. Thunderbird does not give any errors for collection of email though none are appearing in the inbox. There are messages on the server waiting to be collected.

There is a timeout on the SMTP when trying to send messages so no messages are sent.

I have checked all the settings and they are as follows: POP account port 110 smtp port 587 Using START and normal password authentication for both.

I have tried numerous other permutations of configurations as well as restarting Thunderbird after every change. As I mention these are the identical settings used on the laptops which the PC's are replacing. The PC is connected to the internet via ethernet cable and the internet functions fine.

Any ideas out there or anyone having had a similar experience and found a resolution?

title: Unable to use templates since last Win10 update
content:
Hello,

Please apologize my errors, english is not my mothern language. So, my vocabulary may have some lack, and the terms i use to describe some menu's elements are not the one used on the english version.

Last friday, Win 10 update itself. Cause a lot of trouble. I've uninstall this update and all seem to be well again. With Thunderbird, the main problem was i was unable to send a message : smtp problem (which is not due to thunderbird nor from my mail provider, but from W10's update) But there still a problem with my beloved thunderbird : - the templates i use are inactives. When i double-click on them, nothing happen. Even with right-click, "new message from template" : nothing

The only way to use them is to right-clic > open > open in a new [tab/window] > copy and paste in a new message... Even "Modify as a new message" is not working except if i first open it in a new window (and then, when in this new window, CTRL+E).

Before that mess, i was running 128 ESR (up to date).

In desperation, i've done that : - Testing new install of 128 ESR with no uninstall of previous version : same problem - Testing new install of 136, with no uninstall : same problem - Done these both again with uninstall : same problem.

Restarting my computer each time, off course (some much time lost from this morning... ) That's feel me crazy !

I will be grateful to have some help.

PM

PS : W10 because it's my work's computer. No choice for the moment

specifications. 586e51a60fabf-2c6710208efsm2231054fac.17 - gsmtp. Please check the message recipient "" and try again."

"Send Message Error Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: The recipient address <mailto:xx.yy@zz.edu> is not a valid RFC 5321 address. For more information, go to 

https://support.google.com/a/answer/3221692 and review RFC 5321

specifications. 46e09a7af769-72bb267b340sm1748154a34.13 - gsmtp. Please check the message recipient ""mailto:xx.yy"@zz.edu" and try again.

I've looked at those URLs, but the "answers" don't help. Any suggestions?

title: Disappearing emails
content:
I posted this before but have had no response whatsoever after several days. Maybe I posted it under the wrong thread, so am redoing it here. Apologies for repetition.

In the past week or so I have noticed that some emails disappear from one inbox on my Windows 10 PC. I have three Thunderbird accounts (call them A, B, and C), and the emails only disappear from box A. It seems completely random, and furthermore they only disappear on my own PC. My husband has an identical set-up on his Windows 10 PC, which also includes the boxes A, B, and C, and the messages do NOT disappear there. I can also see them on my iPhone and two iPads, and they do not disappear from those. I have tried forwarding them to myself from my phone, and while most of them did show up in the A inbox on my PC, I have noticed that some of them have now disappeared again.

This is incredibly frustrating, because I do most of my work at my PC. I thought I needed an update, but TB says I am up to date (128.8.0esr (32-bit)). It can't be anything to do with the server, because it is so specific: one inbox on one PC only. There doesn't seem to be any special pattern--some have attachments, some don't.

Many thanks for any suggestions!

I also posted two updates under the original question (which had a title something like 'Random emails keep disappearing'), and the problem is still ongoing, making my life a bit difficult, as I am at the moment in contact with doctors, lawyers, and insurers, and I keep losing their emails on my main PC, which holds documents that I sometimes need to attach to replies.

I am very surprised no one has replied (apart from my own updates), as usually there is someone out there with good ideas.

I'd really be grateful if someone could suggest something. Many thanks.
creator: Janet1593

title: GoDaddy outlook.office365 Won't Get Messages
content:
Situation: Thunderbird 128.8.0esr (64-bit) has been performing flawlessly. No problems until I received a security notification that my email account had been accessed by someone quite literately on the other side of the world. And, since I haven’t changed my password in quite a while, I thought, ‘why not go ahead and do it now.’ It seemed like a good idea; not so much.

Prior to changing my password on my GoDaddy outlook.office.365.com email account, I have had absolutely no difficulties in sending and receiving emails from the ‘GoDaddy’ email account nor my gmail email accounts.

After changing only my ‘GoDaddy’ email account password, on the GoDaddy/outlook.offic365 website, I started having negative issues with the ‘GoDaddy outlook.office365’ email account on Thunderbird.


Conditions: At this time I was, and still am, able to send and receive emails on gmail accounts. No difficulties here.

However, I am only able to send emails on the ‘GoDaddy outlook.office365’ email account. I can not ‘Get Messages’ or receive new messages.

I also receive the following ‘notification’: User authenticated but not connected.


I have spent over 18 hours on the phone both voice and text attempting to resolve this issue to no avail.

I was told to change my settings to:

- input: outlook.office365.com. port 993, SSL/TLS, Oauth2 - Output: smtp.office365.com, port 587, STARTTLS, Oauth2

...which I had already set prior to contacting ‘GoDaddy Email Support Team’. After all this I was finally told to “contact Thunderbird to resolve this issue.”

I want to point out, that when I login to the GoDaddy email website via Firefox, I have not issues receiving / sending emails. I also have no issues using the ‘Outlook’ app on my android phone.

In an attempt to possible get a better ‘view point’ on the issue. I closed Thunderbird. Opened up a fresh download of Thunderbird AppImage and opened it in a ‘sandbox’ and ‘setup’ the GoDaddy email account. I still could only send and email. I was unable to ‘Get Messages’.

I have reviewed everything I could find on this forum that even came close to this issue, and, basically nothing changed.

If there is anyone who can provide some guidance, it would be greatly appreciated.
creator: 123buddyc
